name: Your Guess Is As Good As Mine Quiz | Mixed 10 Questions | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who is Edson Arantes Do Nascimento?
questions.explanation:
Pele.

	Pele became the Worlds greatest soccer player and later an ambassador for the sport.

questions.text: All of these were mayors of New York City except?
questions.explanation:
Nelson Rockefeller.

	Dear Nelson was the Governor of New York and went on to become Vice President of the United States.

questions.text: All of these countries are members of the European Union except?
questions.explanation:
Norway.

	All the other three are relative newcomers to the union, having joined in the latter part of the 20th century.

August 16, 1977.

	Do you remember where you were?

questions.text: What are the Pope's guards called?
questions.explanation:
The Swiss Guard.

	They are very visible around Vatican City.

questions.text: Who wrote the song 'Crazy' for Patsy Cline?
questions.explanation:
Willie Nelson.

	Not 'Crazy' about the IRS, are ya Willie?

questions.text: What is the diameter of each clock face of London's Big Ben?
Which of the following is the Italian dish polenta made from?
questions.explanation:
Corn.

	Polenta is an Italian staple which is served in a variety of ways.

questions.text: All these are Monty Python members except one. Who?
questions.explanation:
Rowan Atkinson.

	Dear rubber faced Rowan became better known as the bungling Mr Bean.

questions.text: Which of these did Eric Burdon do?
questions.correct: He was lead singer of 'The Animals'
options: He was an actor in 'Animal House'
He was the author of 'Animal Farm'
He was the host on 'Animal Planet'
questions.explanation:
He was lead singer of 'The Animals'.

	Dear Eric fronted the critically acclaimed British Invasion band, is most remembered, for the classic 'House Of The Rising Sun'. He's still performing  and still touring as a solo artist or in a range of other projects
